alert.note: Alert for Amite; Pike; Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 2:56PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of St. Helena, northeastern Livingston, northern Tangipahoa and northwestern Washington Parishes, western Walthall, Pike and southeastern Amite Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 255 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Montpelier, or 8 miles west of Amite, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mccomb, Greensburg, Amite, Amite City, Magnolia, Kentwood, Summit, Independence, Tylertown, Roseland, Albany, Osyka, Montpelier, Mount Herman, Wilmer, Salem, Gillsburg, Easleyville, Tangipahoa and Tickfaw. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 near mile marker 32. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 36 and 66. Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
